intro: Kyrstenia collina, commonly known as the mountain kyrstenia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered white or greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, fern-like appearance. Kyrstenia collina typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments.
